issues.description: The problem statement text for Part 2 incorrectly says that each PersonController method takes a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter, while both the template and solution PersonController use Consumer<List<Person>>. This is a parameter-type mismatch in the specification text and can confuse students about the expected generic type to use when implementing the controller methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> (not Consumer<List<Note>>) so it matches the template and solution signatures and makes the expected method parameter type unambiguous for students.
